sources.title: The Right Age to Marry
sources.description: “North South divide” (IMBD review quote). A Lancashire cotton mill owner retires to southern England setting off an unfortunate series of events in this dialect comedy from the so-called Manchester School of film-making. Good cast and adequate production values for this low-budget quickie. Recommended. IMDB rating 6.2. Directed by Maclean Rogers. Released in 1935 (UK only). Approximately four minutes are missing (PAL transfer)

metadata.Plot: A Yorkshire mill owner retires and leaves control to his nephew, who promptly gets married.
metadata.Writer: Kathleen Butler, H.F. Maltby, Maclean Rogers
metadata.Actors: Frank Pettingell, Joyce Bland, Ruby Miller
